data.title: XRP price rises 2% to $2.51 due to ETF optimism, targeting $3. Positive netflows of $3.96 million seen.
data.description: XRP, a cryptocurrency, experienced a 2% increase, reaching around $2.51 on Friday due to advancements in its pending spot ETF approval process that boosted optimism in the market. Canary Capital modified its S-1 filing for the XRP spot ETF by eliminating the "delaying amendment," making the registration auto-effective, paving the way for a potential launch on Nov. 13. This adjustment led to a surge in buying activity as traders anticipated imminent approval and speculated on the future price movement after a period of subdued market activity. The ETF is seen as a key driver for institutional investments into XRP, potentially enhancing liquidity in its markets. Notably, on-chain data from Coinglass revealed early accumulation patterns in XRP, with $3.96 million in positive netflows.

data.title: Bitwise CIO Hougan identifies Bitcoin and Solana as top crypto investments with "two ways to win." Bitcoin market could double to $55 trillion, potentially leading to a doubling in its value.
data.description: Matt Hougan, Chief Investment Officer at Bitwise, suggests that the top-performing cryptocurrencies have dual advantages, citing Bitcoin (BTC) and Solana (SOL) as examples. He elaborated in a recent statement that Bitcoin investors can benefit from the growing global "store of value" market, currently valued around $27.5 trillion (with gold at $25 trillion and BTC at $2.5 trillion), and from Bitcoin's increased market share within that industry. If the market value doubles to $55 trillion, Bitcoin could also double in value without a rise in dominance. Alternatively, if Bitcoin's market share increases from 9% to 18%, it has the potential to double in value once more. Hougan's detailed explanation can be found in a recent post on X.

data.title: Fed likely to cut rates, Ed Yardeni predicts stock market meltup similar to 1999 tech bubble. Odds of 'Roaring 2020s' decline to 50%, meltup increases to 30%. S&P 500 up 18.6% YOY, reaching all-time highs post cooler-than-expected CPI print. Fed's easing despite strong economy raises concerns.
data.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to decrease interest rates once again this year, despite the economy not necessarily requiring the assistance. This move could potentially lead to a stock market surge similar to the late 90s tech boom, speculated by Ed Yardeni. Yardeni adjusted the chances of a "Roaring 2020s" bull market from 55% to 50%, while increasing the likelihood of a more fervent meltup from 25% to 30%. This change comes as a result of lower inflation than anticipated, continued economic resilience, and the Federal Reserve's commitment to easing monetary policies, even in the absence of significant macroeconomic pressures. Investors are optimistic about the return of the "Fed Put," with the belief that the Fed will intervene to mitigate market downturns if necessary. The S&P 500, represented by the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (NYSE: VOO), has seen an 18.6% increase over the past year and recently hit record highs following September's lower-than-expected Consumer Price Index report. For further details, visit Benzinga.com.

data.title: W.W. Grainger's Q3 earnings rise to $10.21 per share (up from $9.87), with net sales at $4.66 billion (from $4.38 billion).Margins decrease as operating cash flow reaches $597 million.
data.description: W.W. Grainger Inc. (NYSE: GWW) surpassed expectations in their third-quarter financial report. The company posted adjusted earnings of $10.21 per share, a significant increase from $9.87 per share in the third quarter of 2024, exceeding analysts' projected $9.95 per share. Adjusted net sales also saw a boost, rising to $4.66 billion from $4.38 billion in the previous year, slightly above the anticipated $4.64 billion. The adjusted gross profit margin experienced a slight decline to 38.6% from 39.2%, and the adjusted operating margin narrowed to 15.2% from 15.6% year-over-year. This dip in the operating margin was attributed to unfavorable gross margin in High-Touch Solutions â€“ N.A., partially offset by expense leverage in Endless Assortment. Additionally, W.W. Grainger reported operating cash flow of $597 million. For further insights, the complete article is accessible on Benzinga.com.

data.title: Illumina Inc. beats Q3 earnings with $1.34 per share, exceeding $1.17 consensus. Clinical markets show momentum with $1.084 billion sales. Stock rises on positive results.
data.description: Illumina Inc. (NASDAQ: ILMN) stock is on the rise following a strong third-quarter earnings report. The company reported adjusted earnings of $1.34 per share, surpassing the expected $1.17 per share. Illumina highlighted growth in sequencing consumables revenue in clinical markets, which saw a high single-digit increase year-over-year. The company's sales totaled $1.084 billion, surpassing the anticipated $1.065 billion and remaining flat compared to the previous year on reported and constant currency bases. Illumina also settled with the Department of Justice and veterans to resolve a whistleblower lawsuit. For the full story, visit the Benzinga website.

data.title: JP Morgan analyst optimistic on Riot Platforms, Inc.'s HPC expansion. Q3 revenue beats estimates at $180.2M with 1,406 Bitcoin produced.
data.description: Financial analyst Reginald L. Smith from JP Morgan shared insights on Riot Platforms, Inc.'s recent third-quarter FY25 financial results. According to the Earnings Release, Riot posted a revenue of $180.2 million, surpassing analyst predictions of $172.6 million. The Bitcoin mining firm also disclosed earnings of 26 cents per share, exceeding the anticipated 21 cents per share. During the quarter, Riot generated 1,406 Bitcoin, a notable increase from the 1,104 produced in the same quarter of the previous year. For more details, the complete article can be accessed on Benzinga.com.

data.title: AbbVie reports Q3 2025 sales of $15.78B, up 9.1%. Earnings at $1.86 per share, beats consensus of $1.79. Dividend raised to $1.73 per share. CEO: Company shows strong momentum & increases outlook.
data.description: AbbVie Inc. posted third-quarter 2025 sales of $15.78 billion, surpassing the anticipated $15.59 billion, recording a 9.1% increase on a reported basis or 8.4% operationally. Earnings came in at $1.86 per share, a 38% decline, but beat the expected $1.79. The company raised its quarterly dividend from $1.64 per share to $1.73. AbbVie's Chairman and CEO, Robert Michael, expressed satisfaction with the company's exceptional performance and growth potential, emphasizing progress in product portfolio and pipeline advancement. Global net revenues from the... (The rest of the article is available on Benzinga.com)

data.title: Wall Street gains confidence as CPI cools and earnings beat estimates, leading to record highs for Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq. Fed expected to cut rates by 25 basis points. Tech, small caps, energy, and industrials all join rally. Earnings beat profit estimates with 87% of S&P 500 companies exceeding.
data.description: In October, Wall Street saw a change in sentiment as cooler inflation data, positive corporate earnings, and news of a Trump-Xi meeting at the APEC summit boosted confidence. The Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq hit record highs, with small caps, energy, and industrials also participating in the rally. The September CPI came in below expectations, easing fears of "tariff-flare inflation" and solidifying expectations for a 25 basis-point Fed rate cut. Earnings season exceeded expectations, with almost 87% of S&P 500 companies beating profit estimates. The market responded positively to the dovish signal from the Fed and strong earnings, leading to gains on Friday with the S&P 500 up 0.79%, Nasdaq up 1.15%, and Dow up 1.01%. This marked a shift in market sentiment towards a rebuilding of conviction.
